main event: A Navy observer reported seeing a bright, oval-shaped object that appeared to be heading in a straight line and then increased in speed and disappeared from view in Adak, Alaska on January 6, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 1 minute.
The object seemed to increase in speed before disappearing from view.
No weather balloons had been released from Adak at the time of the sighting, and no aircraft were reported in the area.
The sighting was considered a possible satellite.
The report included details from multiple observers, including a pilot, co-pilot, and plane captain.
witnesses: Navy observer, pilot, co-pilot, plane captain
